commander.name: Johann von Ravenstein
commander.previous_service: Continued from 5. leichte Division command upon redesignation

Panzer III.ausf: Mix of Ausf. E, F, G, H (3.7cm and 5cm guns)

Panzer I.ausf: None remaining - all withdrawn by Q3 1941

SdKfz 251.role: Medium armored personnel carrier, command vehicles

SdKfz 10.role: Light prime mover for artillery and AT guns

subordinate_units.notes: Two battalions (I. and II. Abteilung) with 120 tanks total
Added during reorganization, peacetime location Züllichau
Single battalion retained from 5. leichte Division
Retained from 5. leichte Division (originally from 3. Panzer-Division)

tactical_doctrine.role: Mobile armored division for offensive and defensive operations in North African desert warfare
special_capabilities: Desert warfare experience inherited from 5. leichte Division operations (Feb-Aug 1941)
Combined-arms mobile operations with integrated armor, motorized infantry, and artillery
Enhanced anti-tank capability with Panzerjäger-Abteilung 39 and 88mm FlaK guns
Full Panzer division organization with two tank battalions and enhanced infantry strength
tactical_innovations: Upgraded from leichte (light) division to full Panzer division standard with addition of SR 104
Integration of reinforcements from 15. Panzer-Division into cohesive combined-arms force
Addition of MG-Bataillon 8 providing enhanced machine gun firepower for defensive operations
known_issues: Chronic desert vehicle maintenance problems - sand filters inadequate for fine desert dust
Extended supply lines from Tripoli (~1,200km to forward areas) creating fuel and water shortages
Tank mechanical reliability issues in extreme desert heat (up to 50°C ambient temperature)
Mix of obsolescent Panzer II light tanks and older Panzer III variants with 3.7cm guns
Equipment wear from continuous operations since February 1941 as 5. leichte Division
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Extensive desert warfare experience from 5. leichte Division operations including: modified air filtration systems, enhanced water storage capacity, desert camouflage schemes, tactical doctrine adapted for long-range desert maneuver

special_rules: Desert Veterans: +1 movement in desert terrain, +1 initiative for experienced desert warfare
Combined-arms coordination: Enhanced cooperation between armor, infantry, and artillery
Commander von Ravenstein captured 29 November 1941 - use this date for late-1941 scenarios
Supply dependent: -1 combat effectiveness if fuel drops below 3 days
88mm FlaK guns: Devastating anti-tank capability against all Allied armor 1941
historical_engagements: Operation Crusader (November 1941) - defensive battles around Tobruk
Defense against British Operation Battleaxe (June 1941 as 5. leichte Division)
Siege of Tobruk containment operations (continuous throughout Q3 1941)
